programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Real Yield
programme.desc: Not everyone has a lot of money to invest, which is why Bloomberg has financial indices that are based on fixed income, which is also the focus on this weekly show. The program covers news and trends in the fixed-income market and includes interviews with guests from major financial institutions. "Bloomberg Real Yield" incorporates data and analysis from terminal bond experts to help dive into topics that are moving the bond markets in order to help empower viewers to make knowledgeable financial decisions.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: For most, teaching is an honorable profession -- except for Elizabeth (Cameron Diaz). The foul-mouthed, boozy woman can't wait to marry a rich man and quit her job, but she has to rethink her plans when her sugar daddy dumps her. Then Scott Delacorte (Justin Timberlake), a substitute teacher who's cute and rich, arrives. Elizabeth can't wait to sink her teeth into a new meal ticket, but she faces stiff competition from Amy (Lucy Punch), a popular and perky colleague.

programme.title: Just Go With It
programme.desc: His heart recently broken, plastic surgeon Danny Maccabee (Adam Sandler) pretends to be married so he can enjoy future dates with no strings attached. His web of lies works, but when he meets Palmer (Brooklyn Decker) -- the gal of his dreams -- she resists involvement. Instead of coming clean, Danny enlists Katherine (Jennifer Aniston), his assistant, to pose as his soon-to-be-ex-wife. Instead of solving Danny's problems, the lies create more trouble.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

programme.title: Game Night
programme.desc: Max and Annie's weekly game night gets kicked up a notch when Max's brother Brooks arranges a murder mystery party -- complete with fake thugs and federal agents. So when Brooks gets kidnapped, it's all supposed to be part of the game. As the competitors set out to solve the case, they start to learn that neither the game nor Brooks are what they seem to be. The friends soon find themselves in over their heads as each twist leads to another unexpected turn over the course of one chaotic night.

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Stoner Dale Denton's (Seth Rogen) enjoyment of a rare strain of marijuana may prove fatal when he drops his roach in a panic after witnessing a murder. Upon learning that the fancy weed can be traced back to them, Dale and his dealer (James Franco) go on the lam, with a dangerous drug lord (Gary Cole) and crooked cop (Rosie Perez) hot on their heels.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Lilly returns to work several weeks after being shot and tries to convince herself that she is emotionally ready to spearhead the reopening of the 1994 case of three slain boys.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the 1998 case of a reportedly promiscuous 15-year-old girl who was fatally beaten and found partially clothed.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of an Amish teenager who was murdered just weeks after leaving home for Philadelphia to experience rumspringa.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Dean and Sam need to find three items if they want to defeat Dick Roman (James Patrick Stuart) and the Leviathans; Bobby's new trick turns out to be very dangerous.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean team up with Castiel, Meg and Bobby as they prepare to battle Dick Roman (James Patrick Stuart).

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: When Dean emerges from purgatory, his reunion with Sam isn't what he expected; Kevin escapes from Crowley's grasp.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: When Sam and Dean check on Kevin's mother, they discover that Crowley has surrounded her with demons.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean investigate a series of murders where the victims all received organs from the same donor; the brothers find the killer in a trance and reciting an ancient prayer.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: As Dean and Sam investigate a strange murder in a college town, they discover two dead bodies and disturbing video footage.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: After Benny is brutally attacked by vampires, he calls Dean for help; Sam reflects on the life with Amelia he left behind.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: As Dean and Sam investigate a murder, they find Garth (D. J. Qualls) is already on the case; the guys search for an avenging ghost.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Kevin and Mrs. Tran build a demon bomb; Dean and Sam are shocked when Castiel appears.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Castiel tells Sam and Dean that he has decided to become a hunter like them; the guys investigate a series of murders that resemble cartoon deaths.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam secretly asks a hunter named Martin to watch over Benny; Dean is forced to make a difficult decision.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Castiel must rescue an angel being held captive by Crowley; Amelia meets with Sam and asks him to make a choice.

programme.title: Game Night
programme.desc: Max and Annie's weekly game night gets kicked up a notch when Max's brother Brooks arranges a murder mystery party -- complete with fake thugs and federal agents. The friends soon find themselves in over their heads as each twist leads to another unexpected turn over the course of one chaotic night.

programme.title: Dumb & Dumber
programme.desc: Imbecilic best friends Lloyd Christmas (Jim Carrey) and Harry Dunne (Jeff Daniels) stumble across a suitcase full of money left behind in Harry's car by Mary Swanson (Lauren Holly), who was on her way to the airport. The pair decide to go to Aspen, Colo., to return the money, unaware that it is connected to a kidnapping. As Harry and Lloyd -- who has fallen in love with Mary -- are pursued across the country by hired killers and police, they find both their friendship and their brains tested.

programme.title: Pineapple Express

programme.title: Ocean's Eight
programme.desc: Debbie Ocean assembles an all-female team of thieves and specialists for a heist during the Met Gala, aiming for the $150 million worth of diamonds around the neck of world-famous actress Daphne Kluger.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the 1953 murder case of a 19-year-old aspiring rock 'n' roller when new evidence suggests he was not killed where his body was found.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: While investigating a Jane Doe's murder, the team discovers that she was a grifter with a male partner and numerous vengeful victims.

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the 1992 case of a 14-year-old inner-city math genius who was shot after his older brother started using him for the illegal benefit of a local gang.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The Cleaners (Kirk B.R. Woller and Darin Cooper) take Wyatt and erase all memory of him; Phoebe's lack of control over her new empathic power makes her start a barroom brawl.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Three evil sisters steal the Charmed Ones' identities and powers; Paige realizes magic will always be a part of her life; Leo tries to find out who put him on the Island of Valhalla.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: When the sisters hold a seance, they contact a vengeful ghost who has been fomenting trouble between families.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: A demon (Desmond Askew) taps into the sisters' secret desires to create an alternate reality; Leo convenes the Elders to strip Chris of his Whitelighter status.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Paige discovers her new boss has swapped his soul for a successful career; Wyatt sabotages Piper's dates; Chris and Leo travel back in time.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: When the Lady of the Lake appears before the Charmed Ones and pleads for help to protect the legendary Sword in the Stone, Piper comes forward and pulls the sword free.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: After vanquishing a Manticore demon, the sisters become foster parents to its orphaned baby; Phoebe surprises her boyfriend by blurting out her true feelings.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: A mysterious woman from the future (Marisol Nichols) arrives to take Chris' powers; the Power of Three is endangered when Paige moves in with Richard and Phoebe joins Jason in Hong Kong.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Paige tries on a pair of Grams' go-go boots and goes back in time; Leo and Chris try to stave off an amorphous creature surrounding the manor.

programme.title: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Lara Croft is the fiercely independent daughter of an eccentric adventurer who vanished years earlier. Hoping to solve the mystery of her father's disappearance, Croft embarks on a perilous journey to his last-known destination -- a fabled tomb on a mythical island that might be somewhere off the coast of Japan. The stakes couldn't be higher as Lara must rely on her sharp mind, blind faith and stubborn spirit to venture into the unknown.

programme.title: Ocean's Eight
programme.desc: Debbie Ocean assembles an all-female team of thieves and specialists for a heist during the Met Gala, aiming for the $150 million worth of diamonds around the neck of world-famous actress Daphne Kluger.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: Dapper Danny Ocean is a man of action. Less than 24 hours into his parole from a New Jersey penitentiary, the wry, charismatic thief is already rolling out his next plan. Following three rules: Don't hurt anybody, don't steal from anyone who doesn't deserve it, and play the game like you've got nothing to lose. Danny orchestrates the most sophisticated, elaborate casino heist in history.

programme.title: Ocean's Twelve
programme.desc: After successfully robbing five casinos in one night, Danny Ocean and his crew of thieves have big problems. Despite pulling off one of the biggest heists in Las Vegas history, the members of the gang have already spent much of the money they stole. Casino owner Terry Benedict demands that Ocean return the money, plus millions more in interest. Unable to come up the cash, the crew is forced to come together to pull off another series of heists, this time in Europe.

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Danny Ocean and his gang hatch an ambitious plot for revenge after ruthless casino owner Willy Bank double-crosses Reuben Tishkoff, Danny's friend and mentor. First, Ocean's gang plan to hit Bank in the paycheck by reversing the precept that the house always wins. Next, they will deal a crushing blow to Bank's ego by ruining his reputation as the only hotelier to earn the Royal Review's Five Diamond Award for each of his properties.
